page.title: 01HOLMESFIELD'S RURAL AREA
page.content: Our area is beautiful,tranquil and unspoilt. Isolated farming hamlets lie in hilly surroundings connected by winding,narrow roads which are often precarious in winter.The Northern fringe of the area consists of stretches of bleak moorland dropping into a pastoral valley. Large{Tudor halls}with{cruck barns are a feature of the area.The district is served by Penny Acres Primary School and Holmesfield Parish Church, St.Swithins.There is also a farm shop. { Mixed farming},mainly dairy,is found in the valleys.Wood plantations and moorland sheep are to be found on the hills.Included in our area is a{fox {hunt},kennels and a{reservoir}. {Cordwell valley}is one of the most beautiful English valleys at rhododendron time .
